title.value: Optimal Zero-Shot Detector for Multi-Armed Attacks
title.justification: The title is derived directly from the provided text.
title.quote: Optimal Zero-Shot Detector for Multi-Armed Attacks

extractions.description: This paper explores defensive strategies against multi-armed attack scenarios where adversaries introduce noise into data samples using various methods. It proposes an innovative information-theoretic zero-shot defense approach that aggregates decisions from multiple pre-existing off-the-shelf detectors without the need for training data. Empirical evaluations using popular computer vision datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of this defense mechanism against known adversarial attacks.

type.justification: The paper includes empirical evaluations and experiments to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed solution using popular computer vision datasets.
type.quote: Empirical evaluations using popular computer vision datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of this defense mechanism against known adversarial attacks.

name.justification: The primary research field focuses on detecting adversarial attacks within the domain of deep learning and machine learning.
name.quote: This paper explores defensive strategies against multi-armed attack scenarios where adversaries introduce noise into data samples using various methods.

name.justification: The paper evaluates its proposed approach using popular computer vision datasets such as CIFAR10 and SVHN.
name.quote: We empirically evaluate the proposed solution on popular computer vision datasets, such as CIFAR10 and SVHN.

name.justification: The paper derives an innovative information-theoretic defense approach and discusses theoretical aspects such as minimax problem formulation and mutual information.
name.quote: we derive an innovative information-theoretic defense approach that optimally aggregates the decisions made by these detectors

name.justification: The paper uses a pre-trained ResNet-18 classifier for empirical evaluation on CIFAR10 and SVHN datasets.
name.quote: For both, the pre-trained target classifier is a ResNet-18 model that has been trained for 100 epochs

is_contributed.justification: ResNet-18 is not a new model contributed by this paper but rather a pre-existing model used for experiments.
is_contributed.quote: the pre-trained target classifier is a ResNet-18 model

is_executed.justification: The model was executed as part of the empirical evaluation.
is_executed.quote: For both, the pre-trained target classifier is a ResNet-18 model that has been trained for 100 epochs

is_compared.justification: The performance of ResNet-18 under adversarial attacks is evaluated and compared with other methods in the paper.
is_compared.quote: Our empirical results...show that aggregating simple detectors using our method results in consistently improved detection performance.

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for ResNet-18 is likely the one that introduces the ResNet architecture.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For both, the pre-trained target classifier is a ResNet-18 model that has been trained for 100 epochs

name.justification: CIFAR10 is used for empirical evaluation of the proposed defense approach.
name.quote: We empirically evaluate the proposed solution on popular computer vision datasets, such as CIFAR10 and SVHN.

referenced_paper_title.value: Learning multiple layers of features from tiny images
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for CIFAR10 is the one that originally introduced the dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Krizhevsky, A. (2009). Learning multiple layers of features from tiny images. Technical report.

name.justification: SVHN is another dataset used for empirical evaluation of the proposed defense approach.
name.quote: We empirically evaluate the proposed solution on popular computer vision datasets, such as CIFAR10 and SVHN.

referenced_paper_title.value: Reading digits in natural images with unsupervised feature learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for SVHN is the one that originally introduced the dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Netzer, Y., Wang, T., Coates, A., Bissacco, A., Wu, B., and Ng, A. Y. (2011). Reading digits in natural images with unsupervised feature learning.

name.justification: The SGD optimizer is used as part of the training process for the classifiers and detectors in the experiments.
name.quote: For both, the pre-trained target classifier is a ResNet-18 model that has been trained for 100 epochs, using SGD optimizer with a learning rate of 0.1

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for SGD optimizer is likely the one originally introducing the stochastic approximation method by Robbins and Monro.
referenced_paper_title.quote: using SGD optimizer with a learning rate of 0.1
